metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8966 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
arch/arm/kernel/sys_oabi-compat.c in the Linux kernel before 4.4 allows local users to gain privileges via a crafted (1) F_OFD_GETLK, (2) F_OFD_SETLK, or (3) F_OFD_SETLKW command in an fcntl64 system call. It was discovered that the fcntl64() system call in the Linux kernel did not properly set memory limits when returning on 32-bit ARM processors. A local attacker could use this to gain administrative privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8966` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-125-generic - 3.13.0-125.174
linux-image-3.13.0-125-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-125.174
linux-image-3.13.0-125-lowlatency - 3.13.0-125.174
linux-image-3.13.0-125-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-125.174
linux-image-3.13.0-125-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-125.174
linux-image-3.13.0-125-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-125.174
linux-image-3.13.0-125-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-125.174
linux-image-3.13.0-125-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-125.174
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-125-generic - 3.13.0-125.174
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-3.19.0-51-generic - 3.19.0-51.57~14.04.1

notes.Note: ratliff> the fix commit is dated Dec. 2015 jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support sbeattie> this was probably introduced with the Open File Descriptor Locks patches in the 3.15 kernel, likely 5d50ffd7.

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-125.174').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-lts-utopic: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-vivid package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.19.0-51.57~14.04.1').
linux-lts-wily: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1').
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-manta: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-signed package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-125.174').
linux-signed-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1').
